headline: A Town Deemed ‘Redmen’ to Be a Racist Mascot. Then Republicans Took Over the School Board.
abstract: The symbol was removed in a Connecticut town. Now, newly empowered Republicans are restoring it.
lead_paragraph: In July, the school board in a small Connecticut town called Killingly took what local officials said was a long-overdue step: removing the name of the school mascot, Redmen, which some Native Americans have deemed racist.
